intro: Matricaria corymbosa, commonly known as the chamomile plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers and a strong, aromatic scent. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers are used in herbal teas and remedies due to their calming properties. Matricaria corymbosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
